headline: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon Once Called Bitcoin A 'Pet Rock' — Now He Says Crypto, Stablecoins Are 'Real, We'll All Use Them'
summary: JPMorgan Chase (NASDAQ:JPM) CEO and longtime Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) critic Jamie Dimon has acknowledged that crypto, blockchain, and stablecoins are "real." This marks a notable shift in tone as his bank prepares to let institutional clients use ...

headline: BlackRock's IBIT Sheds $291M in a Day, as Bitcoin ETFs Pull Back
summary: BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF posted its largest outflow since August, but the longer-term picture for institutional demand remains intact.

headline: TXSE Group raises $250 million in capital following second funding round
summary: TXSE Group announced today the completion of its second-round financing, bringing its total capital raised to more than $250 million as it readies the launch of the Texas Stock Exchange in the first quarter of 2026.

raw.headline: TXSE Group raises $250 million in capital following second funding round
raw.summary: TXSE Group announced today the completion of its second-round financing, bringing its total capital raised to more than $250 million as it readies the launch of the Texas Stock Exchange in the first quarter of 2026.

headline: JPMorgan Unit Invests in Texas Stock Exchange
summary: The upstart trading venue raised $90 million, bringing its total haul above $250 million ahead of a planned 2026 launch.

headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Cloud City
summary: Meta Platforms plunged after it reported earnings.  Like Google and Microsoft, Meta is spending aggressively on artificial intelligence and raised estimates for capital expenditures next year.  The lenders have accused Bankim Brahmbhatt, the owner of Broadband Telecom and Bridgevoice, of fabricating accounts receivable that were supposed to be used as loan collateral.

headline: BlackRock loses $500m on shadow banking blow-up
summary: The world’s biggest investment group is facing a $500m (£380m) hit after its shadow banking business fell victim to an alleged fraud.
